Name: Charminar
About: An identifying feature of the city, Charminar is the most prominent landmark of Hyderabad. It was erected by Quli Qutub Shah to signify the founding of Hyderabad. Everyone coming to the city, definitely visits the Charminar. It is also famous for the market that sprawls around it and is called 'Laad' or 'Chudi' Bazaar.

Name: Golconda Fort
About: Golconda Fort is a massive fortress whose ruins stand proudly even today displaying the glory of its rich past and some untold sagas of the city's history. It is reputed for being the area where once, the mighty Koh-I-Noor diamond was stored. In the evening, Golconda Fort comes to life with the light and sound show.

Name: Ramoji Film City
About: Located on the outskirts of Hyderabad, Ramoji Film City is certified as the World's largest Film Studio Complex by the Guinness Book of World Records. spread over 2500 acres, it can accommodate 20 film units at one go. One can reach Ramoji Film City through a number of packaged tours and buses that leave regularly from the city.

Name: Hussain Sagar Lake
About: Hussain Sagar Lake is one of a largest man-made lake situated in Hyderabad. Renowned for its monolith of Lord Buddha placed right at the center of the lake, the place is famously known as a Tank Bund, a popular spot of tourist attraction.

Name: Salar Jung Museum
About: The Salar Jung Museum is located at Darushifa, on the southern bank of the Musi River, in Hyderabad. This is one of the three national museums in the country. The collection of museum was sourced from the property of Salar Jung Family and it has a myriad collection of paintings, sculptures, carvings, manuscripts etc.

Name: Birla Mandir
About: One of the popular attractions in Hyderabad, Birla Mandir is dedicated to the Lord Venkateshwara of Tirumala and is modelled after and is the replica of the idol of Balaji of Tirupati. The temple itself is located at the top of a 280 feet tall hill called the Naubat Pahad that overlooks both, Hyderabad and Secunderabad and is one of the best viewpoints in the city.

Name: Purani Haveli
About: Originally built to serve as the home to the Peshwa of Mohammed Quli Qutub Shah, Mir Momen, Purani Haveli is converted into a museum known for its remarkable exhibits of artwork and talent. It houses a fascinating collection of items gifted to Mir Osman Ali Khan, the seventh Nizam of Hyderabad.

Name: Jala Vihar
About: Sprawling over an area of 12.5 acres adjacent to Hussain Lake, Jalvihar is the largest water amusement park in Hyderabad.  It also has rain dance, indoor game zone, dry rides and an enormous food court.

Name: Chowmahalla Palace
About: The Chowmahalla Palace of Hyderabad once served as the official residence of the Nizams of Hyderabad during their reign still retains some of its past splendour. The architecture of the palace is an imposing sight to behold. The facade itself is a delicate artwork of domes, arches, windows and meticulously carved out designs.

Name: Lumbini Park
About: Lumbini Park is a gorgeous urban park named after Lumbini of Nepal. Located alongside Hussain Sagar, the park has an artificial water tank. A huge statue of Lord Buddha is installed in the tank which can be reached through paddle boats. The park also holds musical fountain shows.

Name: B.M
About: A one of its kind planetarium, the Birla Planetarium is one of the most modern planetariums in India. It is most popular for the Sky Show, the theme of which changes each year. The planetarium also houses a museum, science centre, art gallery and dinosaurium.

Name: Nehru Zoological Park
About: With about a 100 species finding habitats here, the Nehru Zoological Park is one of the largest zoos in India. Also known as Hyderabad Zoo, it houses the Indian Rhino, Asiatic Lion, Bengal Tiger, Indian Elephant as well as panthers, pythons, deers, antelopes. The zoo also hosts safaris and educational shows.

Name: Taj Falaknuma Palace
About: Taj Falaknuma Palace is perched around 2000 metres above the city of Hyderabad. Once the royal residence of Nizam- probably the richest man in the world, the palace has now been converted into a five-star luxury heritage hotel.

Name: Snow World Hyderabad
About: The Snow World of Hyderabad is the world's biggest and the first snow-themed park in India. With snow fall produced of mineral water, it is a popular attraction to be visited with kids. It offers activities like ice skating, ice boarding, snow slides with bumping-car, toboggan rides and many more.

Name: Laad Bazaar
About: Laad Bazaar is a famous and historic market known for its shopping souvenirs and bangles. Located adjacent to Charminar, it is one of the oldest markets in Hyderabad. There are more than 150 workshops located here that produce some of the finest bangles called lac bangles.

Name: Necklace Road
About: Necklace Road is a long boulevard that encircles Hyderabad’s Tank Bund, resembling a glittering necklace. Tank Bund consists of the beautiful Hussain Sagar Lake with a giant monolithic statue of Gautama Buddha. Lined with beautiful green gardens, eat streets and local shopping, it is a popular picnic spot.

Name: Qutub Shahi Tombs
About: Located in the Ibrahim Bagh, Qutub Shahi Tombs are a group of small and big mosques and tombs built by the rulers of the Qutub Shah dynasty. The tombs are all built on a raised platform and have a dome-shaped structure. The little tombs are single-storeyed while the bigger ones are double storeyed.

Name: NTR Gardens
About: Located adjacent to the Hussain Sagar Lake in Hyderabad, NTR Gardens is a tiny but gorgeous park dotted with brightly coloured plants and tall trees. Boasting of well-groomed landscaping, ornate lamp posts and brilliant water fountains, the NTR Gardens park also has a souvenir shop, toy train, freefall, restaurants and variety of fun activities.

Name: Durgam Cheruvu
About: Durgam Cheruvu is a serene and picturesque lake which once served as a water source for the Golconda fort. It is a lively and vibrant spot for pedal boating, camping, and trekking. The historical lake is also popular for its sunrise and sunset views.

Name: Shilparamam
About: Situated in Madhapur area of Hyderabad, Shilparamam is a traditional crafts village created with the idea to preserve and conserve traditional crafts. The village has been set amidst cascading waterfalls and lush greenery; it has sections designated to depict each region of the country.

Name: Chilkur Balaji Temple
About: Chilkur Balaji Temple is situated in the picturesque village of Chilkur, about 30kms from Hyderabad. It is also called the VISA Temple because it is believed that paying your obeisance to the presiding deity, Lord Balaji Venkateswara, along with Sridevi and Bhoodev can grant your wishes of gaining a USA Visa!

Name: Food in Hyderabad
Distance: 22 out of 85  places to visit in Hyderabad
About: When you are in Hyderabad, you are bound to try out the very famous Hyderabadi Biryani that comes along with a curry and raita. It is one of the top things to do in Hyderabad and it comes with mutton, chicken and even with vegetables (for all you vegetarians).

Name: Inorbit Mall
About: Located in the Madhapur area in Hyderabad, Inorbit Mall is a massive mall replete with big brand stores, food chains, local eateries and game zone. The mall also has an enormous parking and a huge movie theatre.

Name: Iskcon Hyderabad
About: ISKON temple of Hyderabad is located in the Nampally region. The main deity in the temple is Lord Krishna. One can also see idols of Sri Gaura-Nitai, Sri Jagannatha Baladeva-Subhadra and Sri Radha Madana-Mohana.

Name: Taramati Baradari
About: Taramati Baradari is an ancient sarai (resting place) built during the reign of Ibrahim Quli Qutub Shah. The building is now a cultural complex which has an open-air auditorium for 1600 people, air-cooled theatre which can accommodate 500 people, a banquet hall and a multi-cuisine restaurant.

Name: Mount Opera Theme Park Resort
About: With a startling amount of choices available on amusement rides, from Ferris wheel to Columbus, the Mount Opera Theme Park resort are ideal for a day full of enjoyment and excitement. They also have a few eccentric ones like the Jumping Frogs, Thrillarium and the Alien Planet.

Name: Paigah Tombs
About: Located in the suburbs of Pisal Banda in Hyderabad, Paigah Tombs are a group of tombs of the Paigah royal family. Although now in a derelict and dilapidated state, the Paigah Tombs still boast of striking architecture and marvellously carved marble panels.

Name: Sanghi Temple
About: Said to be a replica of the Tirumala Temple, the Sanghi Temple is dedicated to Hindu God Venkateswara. It situated about 35 kms from Hyderabad in Sanghi Nagar. Perched atop the Parmanand Giri Hill, it has a magnificent gopuram and boasts of marvellous architecture.

Name: Mecca Masjid
About: Mecca Masjid in Hyderabad is one of the oldest and largest mosques in the city. The bricks used here are believed to be from Mecca, and hence the name. Its interiors are a testament to the grandeur of the rulers of the Quli dynasty.

Name: Forum Sujana Mall
About: Located in Kukatpally in Hyderabad, Forum Sujana Mall is a shopping mall mostly popular for the launching of its big brand store- Zara.

Name: Hyderabad Botanical Garden
About: Situated in the Hi-Tech city, around 16 kms from the city centre of Hyderabad, Hyderabad Botanical Garden is a major attraction of the city. The park boasts of a rich variety of plants, shrubs, trees, flowering plants and medicinal herbs. In addition to that, several meandering water ways and fountains add to the charm of the place.

Name: Wonderla
About: Wonderla is a water and amusement park in Hyderabad replete with roller coasters, water rides, ferris wheel and a kiddie area. It is the perfect place for an outing with families, especially with little ones in tow.

Name: GVK One Mall
About: GVK One is a gigantic shopping mall situated in Banjara Hills area of Hyderabad. The highlight of the mall is the massive Shoppers Stop outlet sprawling over three floors.

Name: Sudha Cars Museum
About: Sudha Cars Museum is a private museum established in 2010 by Kanyaboyina Sudhakar who displayed hand made cars created by him. All cars have been personally designed to look like everyday objects.

Name: Osman Sagar Lake
About: On the outskirts of Hyderabad, also known as Gandipet is the Osman Sagar lake. Elless world, Ocean park and Treasure island surround this lake, making it a famous tourist destination. Spend some relaxed and enjoyable time here, with gardens and a pool, all making it an ideal spot for picnics.

Name: Nizams Museum
About: Nizams Museum is a royal museum, situated in the heart of Purani Haveli housing the memorabilia and artifacts of the then Nizam of Hyderabad. The most popular artefacts include a 1930 Rolls Royce, Mark V Jaguar and Packard.

Name: Nagarjuna Sagar Dam
About: Somewhere between the city of Hyderabad and a district called Guntur in Andhra Pradesh, is one of India's earliest and largest dams.

Name: Amaravathi
About: It is famous for its Amareswara temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. The temple is one of the famous Pancharamas.

Name: City Shopping
About: With jewelry that pleases the eye, handicrafts that woo the artistic you and spices to make your food even more luscious, Hyderabad promises to be a shopping fiesta at for everyone. Colorful bangles and embroidery textiles are another attraction here.

Name: Peddamma Temple
About: Situated in Jubilee Hills in Hyderabad, Peddamma Temple is a Hindu temple enshrine by the supreme mother. She is the most supreme of the 11 forms of village deities. Besides the main shrines, the temple has idols of Lakshmi, Ganpathy and Saraswati.

Name: Begum Bazaar
About: Begum Bazaar is another wholesale market, an old and traditional shopping area and is the biggest commercial market in the city.

Name: Papi Kondalu
About: Known as Kashmir of South India, Papi kondalu is a hill range in Khammam district, one should not miss while in this area. These hills are one of the most visited tourist attraction in Andhra Pradesh.

Name: Madina Market
About: The Medina Market is known for wholesale cloth and textile shops, popular in the city.

Name: Sri Jagannath Temple
About: Located in Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Jagannath Temple is a modern Hindu temple built by the Odia community dedicated to Hindu God Jagannath- God of the Universe.

Name: Spanish Mosque
About: Located within the Paigah Palace Begumpet, Hyderabad; Spanish Mosque is a massive Muslim mosque that can accommodate around 3000 people at once.

Name: Toli Masjid
About: The Toli Masjid is a flamboyant mosque, situated in the suburban area of Karvan, located nearly 2 km away from the Golconda fort. The masjid is one of the many gorgeous memorials in Hyderabad.

Name: AP State Archaeology Museum
About: AP State Archeology Museum aka Hyderabad Museum is a museum located in Hyderabad, India. It is the oldest museum in Hyderabad state. Archeologist Henry Cousens first explored the site in the beginning of the 19th century, and around 1940 the mound was excavated under the supervision of Nizam of Hyderabad. The excavated items were placed in a museum built on the ancient site. In 1952, the museum's contents were moved to the current location, under the guidance of Archaeological Survey of India.

Name: Nalgonda
About: Located at a distance of around 107 km from the city of Hyderabad, this town has been around for many centuries and is a great evidence of Paleolithic and Neolithic sites around the area.

Name: Nizamabad
About: Nizamabad is located around 200 km away from the city of Hyderabad. The city has a dynamic and beautiful blend of Muslim and Hindu population, cultures and livelihoods.

Name: Khammam
About: This age old town is located in the North Central part of the state and has a rich historical significance, one must witness, while here.

Name: Malwala Palace
About: Malwala Palace is an 18th century historical monument located on the Moghalpura, Hyderabad. The ancient structure boasts of Rajput and Mughal architectural styles and has special imported teak wood furniture.

Name: Mallela Theertham
About: Imagine yourself in front of a meandering and brimming waterfall surrounded by lush green trees which are adorned with blooming flowers. The sweet fragrance of the water and flowers in the air making the place heavenly and magical. If you think such a place only exists in imagination, Mallela Theethram will prove you wrong. Nestled in the state of Telangana, Mallela Theertham is a hidden gem untouched by industrialization and bountiful in scenic beauty. Falling from a height of about 150 feet, this waterfall is quite a sight to see. The serene and pristine water of the fall will rejuvenate your body and soul.

Name: Wild Waters
About: Spread over 30 acres of land area, Wild Waters Amusement and Adventure Park is the ultimate theme park in the city. The park boasts of umpteen dry thrill rides, adventure rides, roller coasters, water slides etc. The magnificent food court offers a variety of cuisines both international and domestic. The amusement park is considered one of the most beautiful ones in the city.

Name: Leo Splash
About: Located in Shamirpet in Hyderabad, the magnanimous amusement park Leo Splash boasts of dry rides, water rides, rain dance with DJ, roller coaster rides, separate rides for kids, water zorbing, lazy rides etc. Considered to be one of the most fun hang-out places in the city, the park stays especially crowded during weekends.

Name: Sanjeevaiah Park
About: Spread over 92 acres on land on the banks of Hussain Sagar Lake, Sanjeevaiah Park is dedicated to the former President of India Dr Neelam Sanjeeva Reddy. Replete with lush green trees, flowering shrubs, fountains and glossy grass lawns, the park is the perfect place to rewind and rejuvenate from the daily routined life.

Name: Indira Park
About: Spread over an area of 76 acres, Indira Park is believed to have been built in the year 1975. Named after the former Prime Minister Smt. Indira Gandhi, the park houses tall towering trees and plenty of shrubs and flowering place. The park is a popular tourist spot in the city.

Name: Krishna Kanth Park
About: Located in Jawahar Nagar in Hyderabad, Krishna Kanth Park is a popular hangout place among both the adults and the kids. Dotted with swings and sprinkled with benches for the elders to relax, the park is a common favourite among the city folks to relax and rewind amidst nature.

Name: Jalagam Vengal Rao Park
About: Jalagam Vengal Rao Park, also known as J V R Park is situated in Banjara Hills neighbourhood of Hyderabad. Named after the 5th Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh, the park is now managed privately. It is ideal for early morning and evening walks and provide the much needed respite from the din of the city.

Name: DGS Melkote Park
About: Located in Bhawani Nagar, DGS Melkote Park is spread over an enormous area. The park houses a plethora of swings for kids. The presence of several shady trees make it an ideal place for an outdoor day picnic. People also visit it for early morning and evening walks.

Name: Kidwai Garden
About: Situated in Himayath Nagar in Hyderabad, Kidwai Garden boasts of lush green trees, vibrant blooming flowers and an all around aesthetic atmosphere. A very popular tourist spot of the city, the garden is visited by kids, adults and couples alike.

Name: Priyadarshini Park
About: Priyadarshini Park is situated adjacent to Saroornagar Lake in Hyderabad. With beautifully landscaped lawns, swings and snack stalls, the park is a common favourite hang out place for the city folks. The lake adjacent to it offers magnificent views of the city in the moonlight. Also, don't forget to go boasting while you are at it.

Name: Public Gardens
About: Built in 1846, during the Nizam's reign, Public Gardens is considered to be the oldest set of parks in Hyderabad. Also known as the Bagh-e-Aam, the park houses many building of historical and political importance including the very popular Lotus Pond.

Name: Ocean Park
About: Located at a distance of 20 kms from the main city near Gandipet Lake, Ocean Park is one among the most popular amusement parks of Hyderabad. Out of the two sections in the park, on is a huge water park and a vibrant amusement park dominates other half of it. Some of the rides are included in the tickets while others are charged separately.

Name: Escape Water and Adventure Park
About: Situated in Shamshabad in Hyderabad, Escape Water and Adventure Park literally helps you escape from the monotony and routine of your life. The fun amusement park is also a popular dinner and date place besides being a regular water park. It also facilitates a plethora of adventure activities.

Name: Elles World
About: Located near Ocean Park near Gandipet in Hyderabad, Elles World is another popular water amusement park in the city. Boasting of a plethora of rides both regular and water, the park is a hit among both the adults and the kids. It also has a huge food court where you can nurse your hunger pangs after your exciting water activity episodes.

Name: Mrugavani National Park
About: Located in the slightly silent and remote region of Chilkur in Hyderabad in the state of Telangana, Mrugavani National Park is the most popular weekend getaway for the locals and a common favourite destination of the tourists.

Name: Naya Qila
About: Naya Qila is an extended version of the Golkonda Fort in Hyderabad. Built by Qutb Shahi, the fort is still one of the most popular sources of tourism in the city.

Name: Gomajipet Fort
About: Gomajipet Fort is situated at a distance of 110 kms from Hyderabad and is a popular tourist attraction of the city. It has lately been restored and boasts of magnificent architecture and reflects grandeur and splendour in all its glory.

Name: Asmangadh Fort
About: Asmangadh Fort or Asmangadh Palace is situated in Hyderabad. The name literally translates to "home in the sky" because the palace was situated on a hill top. Lately, it has been converted into a school for children, called the St. Joseph's Public School.

Name: Kalakriti Art Gallery
About: Located in Banjara Hills in Hyderabad, Kalakriti Art Gallery is one of the finest and the most popular galleries in the city. The place has a beautiful decor and hosts large exhibitions frequently which attract a lot of art connoisseurs and tourists.

Name: Muse Art Gallery
Distance: 71 out of 85  places to visit in Hyderabad
About: Muse Art Gallery is situated opposite the Hussain Sagar Lake inside the Mariott Hotel. The gallery was founded by Marriott and Kaali Sudheer Mopperthy and is a non-profit organization. It hosts several exhibitions to raise funds for the vulnerable and needy including funds to combat for AIDS awareness campaign and child labour.

Name: Shrishty Art Gallery
About: Shrishty Art Gallery is situated in the Venkatagiri, Jubilee Hills in Hyderabad and is one of the most visited and renowned art galleries of the city.

Name: ICONART Gallery
About: Situated in Banjara Hills, ICONART Gallery is another one of the most renowned and sought after galleries in Hyderabad. The gallery encourages new and budding artists and even has an art-curator and a critic who curates and organizes exhibitions. The gallery hosts frequent exhibitions and displays of stunning artworks.

Name: Pegasus Art Gallery
About: Jubilee Hills in Hyderabad is a hub for art galleries. Another one of the beautiful art galleries in the area is Pegasus Art Gallery which is a big hit and quite popular among the professional artists.

Name: Alankritha Art Gallery
About: Situated in Kavuri Hills in Hyderabad, Alankritha Art Gallery encourages the contemporary and budding artists by hosting umpteen exhibitions to display the art works. The gallery hosts several solo artist and also group exhibitions.

Name: State Gallery of Fine Art
Distance: 76 out of 85  places to visit in Hyderabad
About: Boasting of beautiful decor and gorgeous decor, State Gallery of Fine Arts hosts several exhibitions and displays, exhibiting artworks of the contemporary, young and budding artists.

Name: Inspire Art Gallery
About: Located in Hyderguda in Hyderbad, Inspire Art Gallery is a renowned art gallery promoting young talents and budding artists. The gallery encourages contemporary artists and hosts several exhibitions displaying contemporary and modern artwork.

Name: Gallery Space
About: Located in MLA Colony in Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Gallery Space is a dainty place popular for its stunning exhibitions and art works. The gallery promotes modern art and contemporary artists. It hosts several exhibitions and you are most likely to find one when you are visiting.

Name: Divya Institute of Arts and Paintings Gallery
About: Located in Kompally near Hyderabad, Divya Institute of Arts and Paintings Gallery is a one of a kind unique gallery which displays and promotes art paintings and water color paintings. This is also a renowned art school that takes part in various social activities and causes.

Name: Saritas Art Gallery
Distance: 80 out of 85  places to visit in Hyderabad
About: Situated on Road No. 10 in Banjara Hills in Hyderabad, Sarita's Art Gallery is one among the finest galleries int the city and is a top name for the art connoisseurs.

Name: Daira Center for Arts and Culture
About: Daira Center for Arts and Culture situated in Banjara Hills, Hyderabad is a popular institute for art and culture. It promotes and features art and crafts works by talented budding artists. The place has a separate space to display art works of its own students.

Name: KBR National Park
About: Located in the Jubilee Hills area of Hyderabad, KBR National Park, or Kasu Brahmananda Reddy Park, also known as Chiran Fort Palace is a world-famous national park. Boasting of picturesque beauty and a wide variety of flora, fauna and avifauna.

Name: DaVinci Frames & Fine Art
Distance: 83 out of 85  places to visit in Hyderabad
About: DaVinci Frames & Fine Art is another one of the fine art galleries situated in Panjagutta in Hyderabad. The gallery encourages and promotes artists of the next generation. It also holds frequent workshops and exhibitions for art lovers and students.

Name: Narsapur Forest
About: Narsapur Forest Range is a well-kept secret of Telangana, hidden away near the tiny village of Narsapur. Laden with green trees and bushy shrubs, the place is perfect to go on a hiking trail with a group of friends.

Name: Deccan Festival
Distance: 85 out of 85  places to visit in Hyderabad
About: Deccan Festival is an annual celebration in Hyderabad that goes on for a span of 5 days. It is also known as the Hyderabad festival and is known to be celebrated in an extravagant fashion.
